meanings.sent1: The puppy was very arousable when it heard the sound of its favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The music had an arousable effect on the audience, making them want to dance.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock seemed to be more arousable than the heavy sleeper.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for painting was so arousable, it ignited a spark in everyone who saw her work.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting over the ocean created an arousable scene of beauty and tranquility.

meanings.definition: Able to be awakened or stimulated.
meanings.sent1: The coffee was highly arousable, instantly waking up the tired student.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's curiosity was so arousable that he never stopped asking questions.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful nature made it easily arousable by a dangling toy.
meanings.sent4: The city was an arousable hub of activity, always buzzing with energy.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's enthusiasm was so arousable, it inspired her students to learn and grow.
